headNote.p: Sanger, who went to Vancouver at the invitation of Laura Jamieson of the Women's International League for Freedom and Peace and Helen Gutteridge of Vancouver's Tribes and Labour Council, delivered this speech at the Hotel Vancouver. She had stopped in Canada on her way to Alaska. No final version found. For similar notes for speeches, see Cincinnati, OH on Nov. 22, 1922 and Buffalo, NY on Feb. 9, 1922. Handwritten intelineations by Margaret Sanger
